The vaccine is effective. No antiviral therapy is available, but supportive treatment is relatively effective. Aedes Egypti control is effective but difficult.
55
There is no human-to-human transmission. Epidemics are related to mosquitoes.
Worldwide, there were 84,000–170,000 severe cases in 2013.
Yellow Fever shows no occupational concentration.

The disease is exceptional in Europe. For 2017, European Union/European Economic Area countries reported 1 travel-related case of Yellow Fever. The case was reported by the Netherlands with exposure in Suriname.
